meanings.definition: A sudden fall or slide of a large mass of rock down a mountainside.
meanings.sent1: The loud rockslide blocked the road.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were warned about the dangerous rockslide.
meanings.sent3: The rockslide seemed to have a mind of its own, choosing the worst time to tumble down.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions came crashing down like a rockslide, overwhelming her.
meanings.sent5: The roaring sound of the rockslide echoed through the valley, leaving everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to rockslide the mountain with your digging.
meanings.sent2: The construction work could accidentally rockslide the cliff.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to rockslide the sandcastle his little sister built.
meanings.sent4: Her powerful speech seemed to rockslide the audience into action.
meanings.sent5: The loud music seemed to rockslide the quiet atmosphere of the library.

meanings.sent1: The town was in chaos after the devastating rockslide.
meanings.sent2: The rescue team arrived to assess the damage caused by the rockslide.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected cancellation of the event was a rockslide of disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The news of the merger created a financial rockslide in the stock market.
meanings.sent5: The rockslide left a scar on the mountain, forever changing its appearance.
